definition[0]: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
example[1]: A loose flap of skin covered the wound.
definition[1]: the noisy movement of something such as cloth in the air
definition[2]: a part of the wing of an aircraft that can be raised or lowered to help the aircraft go up or down
definition[3]: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly
definition[4]: to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise
example[3]: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
example[4]: Flap your arms to keep warm.
definition[5]: to behave in an excited or nervous way
